CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1 shows the optical absorption spectra of PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT in CHCl 3 solution and in thin films spin - coated on quartz plates.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-BT
2. PDTP-DTBT
3. PDTP-DT2BT

These are the Material Names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PDTP-BT
2. PDTP-DTBT
3. PDTP-DT2BT

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to Material Names. All other entities in the paragraph are not relevant to the Material Names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1 shows the optical absorption spectra of PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT in CHCl 3 solution and in thin films spin - coated on quartz plates.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are likely the names of specific compounds or materials. In the context of the paragraph, they can be considered as "Material Property" entities, with the properties being their optical absorption spectra.

2. CHCl3: This is the name of a solvent. It can be considered as a "Medium Property" entity, with the property being the solution in which the optical absorption spectra are taken.

3. Quartz plates: These are the substrates on which the thin films are spin-coated. They can be considered as "Material Property" entities, with the properties being the quartz plates themselves.

4. Optical absorption spectra: This is the property being measured or observed in the paragraph. It can be considered as a "Property Name" entity, representing the specific type of spectral data being obtained for each material.

5. In CHCl3 solution and in thin films: These are the conditions under which the optical absorption spectra are obtained. They can be considered as "Experimental Condition" entities, with the properties being the solvent and the thin films, respectively.

6. Spin-coated: This is the method used to apply the thin films onto the quartz plates. It can be considered as a "Technique" or "Process" entity, with the property being the spinning action used to apply the films.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are the material names.
2. Optical absorption spectra: This is the property being measured or observed.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Optical absorption spectra of PDTP-BT |
| Optical absorption spectra of PDTP-DTBT |
| Optical absorption spectra of PDTP-DT2BT |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1 shows the optical absorption spectra of PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT in CHCl 3 solution and in thin films spin - coated on quartz plates.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are the names of specific materials or compounds. In the context of this paragraph, they can be considered as "Property Value" entities, representing different types of PDTP-based materials.

2. CHCl3 solution: This is a solution made of a specific solvent (Chloroform, CHCl3) and can be considered as a "Property Value" entity, representing the medium used for taking the optical absorption spectra of the PDTP-based materials.

3. thin films: This is a property or state of the PDTP-based materials, specifically referring to the form they take when spin-coated on quartz plates. It can be considered as a "Property Value" entity.

4. quartz plates: These are the substrates or supports on which the thin films of PDTP-based materials are spin-coated. They can be considered as "Property Value" entities, representing the material used for supporting the thin films.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT: These are PDTP-based materials with different compositions, which can be considered as "Property Value" entities, representing the specific types of materials under investigation.

2. CHCl3 solution: This is a solvent used for taking the optical absorption spectra, which can be considered as a "Property Value" entity, representing the medium used for studying the materials' properties.

3. thin films: This is a property or state of the PDTP-based materials when they are spin-coated on quartz plates, which can be considered as a "Property Value" entity, representing the form or configuration of the materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                   |
|-------------------------------|
| PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, PDTP-DT2BT |
| CHCl3 solution                |
| thin films                    |
